SEARCH
Package gw.api.webservice.importTools

Interface IImportTools

All Known Implementing Classes:
ImportToolsImpl
public interface IImportTools
IImportTools is a remote interface to a set of tools to import XML data to the server. See application import XSD for the XML format.

  • Method Details

    • importXmlData

      ImportResults importXmlData(String xmlData) throws DataConversionException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Import XML data. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Parameters:
      xmlData - The data to import, passed as a String.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • importXmlDataAsByteArray

      ImportResults importXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData) throws DataConversionException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Parameters:
      xmlData - The data to import, passed as a byte[] for the UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
      SOAPException
      PermissionException
      See Also:
      • importXmlData(String)

    • importCsvData

      ImportResults importCsvData(String csvData, int dataSet, boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws DataConversionException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Import XML data. See the file APPNAME_import.xsd, where APPNAME is cc, pc or bc, for details of the expected XML format. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
      <![CDATA[
      
   ...import XML...
      
 ]]>
      Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

      WARNING: this is only supported for certain tables: (1) administrative database tables, such as User; (2) new customer-defined entities that are simple reference tables (look up tables). Because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data, any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported.

      Parameters:
      csvData - The data to import, passed as a String.
      Returns:
      Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
      Throws:
      DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • csvToXml

      String csvToXml(String csvData, boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws SOAPServerException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported by importXmlData(String)
      Parameters:
      csvData - A String containing CSV data
      ignoreNullConstraintViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
      ignoreAllErrors -
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
      Throws:
      SOAPServerException
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • csvToXml

      String csvToXml(String csvData, int dataSet, boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations, boolean ignoreAllErrors) throws SOAPServerException, SOAPException, PermissionException
      Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported importXmlData(String)
      Parameters:
      csvData - A String containing CSV data
      dataSet - An int defining the number of the dataset to be imported. Datasets are ordered by inclusion, and the smallest dataset is always numbered 0. Thus Dataset 0 is a subset of dataset 1, and datatset 1 is a subset of dataset 2, etc. If this param is set to -1, all data will be imported.
      ignoreNullConstraintViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
      ignoreAllErrors -
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
      Throws:
      SOAPServerException
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • xmlToCsv

      String xmlToCsv(String xmlData) throws SOAPException, PermissionException
      Export XML data into CSV data. The reverse operation from #csvToXml(String)
      Parameters:
      xmlData - String containing CSV data
      Returns:
      a String containing equivalent import data in CSV format. The result of calling csvToXml on the result should be an equivalent XML document to #xmlData.
      Throws:
      SOAPException
      PermissionException

    • rebuildRolePrivileges

      void rebuildRolePrivileges() throws SOAPException, SOAPServerException
      Rebuild the role privileges data by deleting the priviliges data in the database, and then re-importing the roleprivileges.csv file.
      Throws:
      SOAPException
      SOAPServerException
